page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The name{Frosterley}means "forester's clearing". In the Boldon Book it was described as a manor held by Rolf the Crafty on payment of half a mare. Rolf maintained eyries of hawks for the use of the Bishop of Durham. { {Chapel Close}is the site of a medieval chapel,dedicated to St.Botolph, dissolved in 1552. The first recorded priest was Ralph Morgan in 1534. { {Frosterley Marble}is a black fossiliferous marble, quarried here for 900 years, found in the cockle beds in limestone strata. it is used in Durham Cathedral and Auckland Castle, and many other places. It was used as a substitute for expensive Purbeck marble.
